Can anyone develop neuropothy in the hands from piano playing???

Hello.Playing piano, if it a newly learnt art, involves a lot of wrist work. The muscles around the wrist are constantly being used. This may lead to carpal tunnel syndrome. Carpal tunnel is a passage from which all the tendons of the forearm muscles enter the hand.Here's is some more information about the carpal tunnel -http://www.pianomap.com/carpal_tunnel.htmlThe median nerve is compressed in the tunnel. This leads to neuropathy. There is pain, tingling, weakness, etc. in the hand.Have you been playing the piano since a long time? Do you think you may have the carpal tunnel?Regards
